body:
# **Space Engineering Guild: Project Final Report****(**[**SEG Proposal**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uMaEwV-ttB9TuYiny5beXy_qAYBIgQ4xG6fMZxjE4YI/edit?usp=drive_web\&ouid=108251135146232016120) **with OKRs)**

1. **Objective 1**: Clarify the ultimate vision through a technical feasibility analysis to put together a technical roadmap towards achieving our ultimate goal. (Pablo, Ari, Rod, Sean Manuel)

   1. **Key Result**: Outline requirements and specifications on our Ultimate Goal of putting a self-sustaining, self-governing settlement on the Moon. 

      1. **Member(s)**: (Pablo Lead), Ari, Rod, Sean, Manuel, Justin

      2. **Results**: [MoonDAO 2030 Vision](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E4VtthW7lEdYboaumkrlJ01hqf298wMu9qniqeNL0fA/edit) [MoonDAO 2030 Vision Synthesis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1geglqndMT6eyKV3ML30p5eW0EpTGgeMEHDljv1FvE2M/edit)

      3. **Score: 0.7**

      4. **Learnings:** We did this in a bottom up way creating conversations and space for people to give their own idea of what MoonDAO’s mission means to them, and then synthesized the visions with GPT4 and human editing. It took longer to do it this way, in the future more structured conversation questions and opening it up to the rest of the DAO might have yielded more ideas to put everything together. Overall we were happy with the results and specification on the mission statement.

      5. **Maintenance**: Updating the ultimate vision as we get closer to it and technology advances will be required every year or so.

   2. **Key Result**: Conduct a broad industry analysis of companies and nations with unique Space capabilities and offerings that would help us achieve our ultimate goal and form strategic partnerships with those groups. 

      1. **Member(s)**: (Ari Lead), Ari, Rod, Sean, Manuel

      2. **Results**: [MoonDAO SEG: CRM & BI](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1irSgsKEVuSym14crbJWzttIzFu0PWDnzXHzXNiGB5Is/edit#gid=1275935435) [MoonDAO SEG](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1acp9mbNrzvdZZjU5Yuxus7_RBVvVWLw4Qaj0qmKpxVI/edit?usp=sharing) [Task 1.2 Executive Summary](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1prh77ZUxx-e_5e1ntYupf8NlFOAZijckHSCXP_zQ1Lk/edit?usp=sharing) [Discord Forum](https://discord.com/channels/914720248140279868/1071299330138447933) [DeSpace Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iStym4Y5hfGjBg4CITGleujqxsyAIPn5UI0HpjkuFmE/edit#gid=1095301022) [Space Agencies Worldwide](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ceShh6WKS7w4tTPhpqyX_OkdzVbYr5UA4b34_VMtP1U/edit#gid=2013124449) [FI Spacetech Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qAgRl2U0zHYe3GBy_UhsF0kED66xJ6zD2U3e7XDE0ik/edit#gid=598933705) [Outer Space Regime Analysis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wNISm0sNAeOIJmYi6VVQmME9aUTjZruA_r7QbDKyyrk/edit?usp=sharing)

      3. **Score: 0.8**

      4. **Learnings:** While there is a robust space industry, SpaceX and Blue Origin are the most aligned for our specific mission. 

      5. **Maintenance**: More companies are being launched regularly 

   3. **Key Result**: Create a full technical roadmap that works back from the ultimate goal with step-by-step milestones (e.g. one year plan, five year plan, ten year plan). **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Member(s)**: Pablo

      2. **Results**: [MoonDAO Roadmap 1.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16tYoSnkGms3gNJ3BGsKneMBXbaHBb51bSgAVlhE5A90/edit?usp=sharing)

      3. **Score: 0.7**

      4. **Learnings:** The roadmap was generated based on the vision. There are a lot of things that need to be clarified about each sub-goal. Costs could vary widely and more precision is needed. However, this provides a framework of prioritization that we can focus our efforts on.

      5. **Maintenance**: I’d like to present this to the Senate and potentially vote to adopt this version of the roadmap as our north-star for where we are heading as a DAO.

   4. **Key Result**: Bring in subject area experts to speak to the DAO

      1. **Member(s)**: Rod

      2. **Results**: <https://fb.watch/jIqwLUHwIA/>, <https://twitter.com/OfficialMoonDAO/status/1632773104132067328> 

      3. **Score: 0.9**

      4. **Learnings:** MoonDAO had a tight schedule, I had to arrange a call with Nadeem a month in advance, ideally we need a clear automated process to propose and schedule AMAs

      5. **Maintenance**: Ongoing task

   5. **Key Result**: Help advise and review reports about technical feasibility in each of the three outlined areas. **(Rod Lead)**

      1. **Member(s)**: Rod

      2. **Results**: [MoonDAO 2030 Vision](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E4VtthW7lEdYboaumkrlJ01hqf298wMu9qniqeNL0fA/edit#), also I (Rod) made comments that IM-1 mission would be delayed, and lifeship could be delivered later but I can’t find it on new discord.

      3. **Score: 0.5**

      4. **Learnings:** We had no real tasks, related to feasibility analysis, however we kickstared sat comms project

      5. **Maintenance**: Ongoing

2. **Objective 2:** Establish consistent Space Engineering Guild Internal Operations and toolsets/workflows for decentralized software and hardware coordination. (Pablo, Rod)1) **Key Result**: Task 2.1: Taking weekly guild notes, notification management (announcing when meetings are starting, collecting an agenda.

   1. **Member(s)**: (Rod Lead), Pablo

   2. **Results**: [MoonDAO SEG Meeting Agendas & Reports](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M2918IUtOwIDtjKHLILuMrti4X9Ut_bIXIR7_Egy3_g/edit#heading=h.8zgaa99t3daf)

   3. **Score:** 0.8

   4. **Learnings:** Taking notes and be active is quite complicated, so a dedicated person for taking notes is preferable 

   5. **Maintenance:** None required.

2) **Key Result**: Task 2.2: Investigation of available tooling and options for distributed hardware workflows, and operational workflows (investigating, deciding, integrating in the MoonDAO workflow). **(Rod Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Rod Lead), Pablo

   2. **Results**: manually pushing ESA proposal working group

   3. **Score:** 0.2

   4. **Learnings:** As SEG was just established, all the processes has to be done manually on weekly calls

   5. **Maintenance:** Future project work.

3) **Key Result**: Task 2.3: Investigation and purchase of general common resources that would enable our teams to be more effective and we can make available to guild members. **(Rod Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Rod Lead), Pablo

   2. **Results**: <https://discord.com/channels/914720248140279868/1077750918772162630>

   3. **Score: 0.0**

   4. **Learnings:** Too soon, not enough working groups.

   5. **Maintenance:** None required.

4) **Key Result**: Task 2.4: Maintenance of Kanban board for task organization and maintenance, checking in on task deliverables and contingencies. Payment operations for contributors. **(Rod Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Rod Lead), Pablo

   2. **Results**: [**https://app.dework.xyz/moondao/space-guild-30162/overview**](https://app.dework.xyz/moondao/space-guild-30162/overview) ****

   3. **Score:** 0.4

   4. **Learnings: Foll** All the tools has to be enforced to use, at the first quarter we has other things, now with ESA group we can start using it

   5. **Maintenance:** Ongoing process

5) **Key Result**: Task 2.5: Review incoming applications and assess their backgrounds on a consistent weekly basis, and assign them a Discord role, onboarding them, and providing support for orientation of the new members. **(Pablo Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Pablo Lead), Rod

   2. **Results**: [Doc](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1EKdMpTPtcfhBMLxGMIE1n7gkKGcMS0M05-9cH7vnXuE/edit?usp=drive_web\&ouid=108251135146232016120) + responding on emails 

   3. **Score:** 0.8

   4. **Learnings:** It’s hard to track responses on emails. A CRM with templates (accepted/rejects/suggest to go to…) is needed. Rod became responsible for responding to prevent double messages. Barriers: Too less people for getting all applicants into interviews, too complex onboarding flow, people felt uncomfortable on the Discord platform.

   5. **Maintenance:** Ongoing

6) **Key Result**: Task 2.6: Moderate and lead weekly guild discussions, making an agenda ahead of time and organizing the conversation for productive use of people’s time. **(Pablo Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Pablo Lead), Rod

   2. **Results**: [MoonDAO SEG Meeting Agendas & Reports](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M2918IUtOwIDtjKHLILuMrti4X9Ut_bIXIR7_Egy3_g/edit#heading=h.8zgaa99t3daf)

   3. **Score:** 0.5

   4. **Learnings:** We need to enforce using agendas, people have to review, fill, and follow the agenda on meetings. Also roundtable updates should be limited to 2-3 minutes (resulting in 20-30 mins for 10 people)

   5. **Maintenance:** ongoing

7) **Key Result**: Taks 2.7: Create new bounties for contingent work for the DAO. Or bounties that serve as an onboarding a technical test for new contributors. **(Rod Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: (Rod Lead), Pablo

   2. **Results**: <https://app.dework.xyz/moondao/weekly-procedures-d/view/board-lch9bsxe?taskId=99f0bb12-c698-47df-81ce-97f44c59c3e1> 

   3. **Score:** 0.1

   4. **Learnings:** One gig was created, however no one pushed towards finishing it. Time limits and responsible person for such task to be introduced

   5. **Maintenance:** None required.**3. Objective 3: Conducting feasibility studies on topics and projects that are currently under-funded challenges and bottlenecks (across logistical, engineering, operations) that would accelerate a settlement on the Moon. (Phil, Pablo, Ari, Sean, Rod)**1) **Key Result:** Task 3.1: Lunar communications infrastructure and technology. Especially how a DAO can use its governance to create nation-agnostic infrastructure. 

   1. **Member(s)**: **(Phil Lead)**

   2. **Results**: [Discord Forum](https://discord.com/channels/914720248140279868/1054527515256950917), [Primer on Lunar Communications Infrastructure (2023)](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sucs5VkPOjvXxCqjKX9_iDs0EJwkVZT3EyQXAgwh6zs/edit?usp=sharing), professional networking with experts in the field

   3. **Score:** 0.3

   4. **Learnings:** There is a lot of interest and necessity for lunar communications infrastructure, but so far most endeavors are experimental, expensive, or difficult to access. There is lots of new technology and a ton of potential for developing new business and governance models. This topic is still nascent and is growing rapidly―there are no clear answers, and that means there's still a lot we can explore.

   5. **Maintenance:** None.

2) **Key Result:** Task 3.2: Bioresearch and astrobiology. Biological life support systems analysis. Radiation shielding, food, structures. How a DAO can help tackle some of these challenges. 

   1. **Member(s)**: **(Ari Lead)**

   2. **Results**: Designed, launched, and facilitating a mission plan for lunar habitat from a DAO perspective. Results in May. [Task 3.2 Research](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LkTkXBQeJDUOOW9cz3jCnY9gh7_ftjA4iPV7kfE3vSQ/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: .**5

   4. **Learnings:** Nascent technology currently in development. 

   5. **Maintenance:** Will follow up with University Student Research

3) **Key Result:** Task 3.3: In-situ resource utilization. Energy, water, material use on the Moon. How a DAO can help create neutral resources to create a foundation for other settlers to build upon. 

   1. **Member(s)**: **(Rod Lead)**

   2. **Results**: To be included in Ari’s University Report

   3. **Score:** .5

   4. **Learnings:** Major advancements coming through Arrtemis Program

   5. **Maintenance:** Supporting students and will publish a report at the end of the semester.

4) **Key Result:** Task 3.4: Establish a common set of criteria for evaluating ideas that extends on the following rough criteria: 

   1. Within the technical capabilities of the DAO (or presents an ambitious challenge that is within reach of our technical abilities).

   2. Creates a sustainable future revenue stream for the DAO.

   3. In-line with our values and secures a positive future settlement on the Moon that includes MoonDAO members.

   4. A DAO is uniquely positioned to challenge the challenge.

   5. Achievable in the next 1-2 years.

   6. Costs no more than 10 million.

   2) **Member(s)**:**(Pablo Lead)**

   3) **Results**: Although we created many ideas for projects, there were none that formally passed through governance or people proposing new ideas in the guild. No common criteria was established outside of what we put together for the roadmap.

   4) **Score: 0.2**

   5) **Learnings:** We need better outreach to engineers. We’re hoping that with the roadmap we can do more calls for proposals from members.

   6) **Maintenance: None.**\
**4. Objective 4: Find one space engineering firm that is willing to outsource some of their tasks to create a bounty on our DeWork page as a pilot for a revenue stream in the DAO. (Pablo)**5) Task 4.1: Find at least one partner that is mission aligned with MoonDAO and is willing to have MoonDAO’s guild to complete a bounty for them. **(Pablo Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: **(Pablo Lead)**

   2. **Results**: We had a lead on this and got pretty far, they wanted to create something so that people could put personal items like ashes into space, after talking to us they realized that their idea was infeasible for what they wanted to do with retrieval, but ultimately it was just a quick analysis and not a contract was drafted. I still consider this still unfinished.

   3. **Score: 0.2**

   4. **Learnings:** We need a better model of how to create this marketplace. Maybe we can leverage the new NFT marketplace to create standard contracts in the form of NFTs. We need better external communications and building a reputation of having quality engineers. Volume for a two way marketplace. Would be good to build a list of capabilities and backgrounds, and create a directory of engineers at MoonDAO that are available for work.

   5. **Maintenance: None**

6) Task 4.2: Manage the logistical, operations, and legal around matching that task with guild members and the right revenue split between the member and the company. **(Pablo Lead)**

   1. **Member(s)**: **(Pablo Lead)**

   2. **Results**: See above. No contract was drafted. This is unfinished.

   3. **Score: 0**

   4. **Learnings:** See above.

   5. **Maintenance: None****5. Objective 5:** Figure out ways to converge Decentralized Science and Open Hardware to benefit the overall development of new and existing technology within MoonDAO. (Manuel Lead)1) **Key Result**: Task 5.1 Identify, build and implement Decentralized Science tools for scientists to contribute their research to MoonDAO.

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results**: [Space Technology Papers Results](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1tSVsb64LpinBsq7W_pvyCeU9nmQO7x0JbbJOQakA9Ac/edit?usp=sharing) [Challenges in Science - DeSci](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LSDjLuKZajuiStPK_ygJ9z7-NzQlRRoxVDwcQjyGDVg/edit?usp=sharing) [DeSci Tools Overview](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12JsoAJvMRc0G1MNd0fsrTUoa1tpag_9k9BGN6IExP70/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: 0.9**

   4. **Learnings: !This report is for current and future MoonDAO members to orient in the Academic world, in the Intellectual Property markets and Prototyping facilities!**(<https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/atoms/files/commercial_space_technology_roadmap.pdf>)_(_[_https://github.com/DeSciWorldDAO/awesome-desci_](https://github.com/DeSciWorldDAO/awesome-desci**)_)_5. **Maintenance:** None.2) **Key Result**: Task 5.2 More qualified space scientists should be drawn to MoonDAO

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results:** [University\_USA\_College\_Towns](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14n5Dq9PH8y6bijEM1w7g5ztd3SlijUAxWQcGA0Yb0-Q/edit?usp=sharing) [SU Exponential Innovation Best Practices](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fU8zuG1EwzyZ0S4MisU-2DMZvgRVquPAdzep5ux5zts/edit?usp=sharing) [YC Startup Advice](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Qg9Smz1RNPweew23GNeo89pkzZBmY_iAiiiErNVzu5w/edit?usp=sharing) [100 Tasks Checklist by Bell Ventures](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Lmd-AXkwvTWLqj9ExSfrxus4aJaPp5gArBcujmSgDzY/edit?usp=sharing) [DAO Building by BioDAO](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IbnTbVJLrm7wyCXfg0wzUgKES3oDcnBl929QuUd73UQ/edit?usp=sharing) [Linkedin Campaign Space Scientists](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BFbqLX1-BNNKhPZAjrp4J4YGzs4EAuHccPcMYfxxGqU/edit?usp=sharing) [MoonDAO Space Science & Sustainability Guild Proposal WIP](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HluxQPkTHV7egQYpeDaoIXjXCLlEEQHbI8lceb7Nm04/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: 0.9**

   4. **Learnings: Connecting to key decision-makers in Science Entrepreneurship:**(<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1A5Pk1G07hFV0rHbrMQZAjag-AUREYz43?usp=sharing>) (<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ppQ-a8RO5dnN6HueynHcS2Ey0A7CzMZI/view?usp=sharing>)(<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dQdYei_F4Ln4PBq1aazTiiwQoDG9m1ya/view?usp=sharing>)Started a campaign via Linkedin to attract 277 NASA Scientists to MoonDAO (68 responses/277 Scientists=25%).5. **Maintenance:** None.3) **Key Result**: Task 5.3 More futurists should be inspired to join MoonDAO

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results**: [Future Studies & Foresight Institutions](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10FGWdD9HOkYqxsTHUDEgOy3lKk1GzQqzepsmOEl4UMw/edit?usp=sharing) [Science Fiction Prototyping Framework](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1h_AMZXO_X8nVkDLTgUuMEsILdErCVjuEVfTxKOHOKm4/edit?usp=sharing) [Outline of Future Studies](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1O1OFKk4VopFbHxTGgJJ2xa-WUDlBZRSnDsTslnOTYRk/edit?usp=sharing) [Outline of Science & Technology Studies](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1pDS6bu4ude5g3h5USbIbiteqkw7Z3OB3seU9jlaW2aE/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: 0.8**

   4. **Learnings:** (<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_fiction_prototyping>)(<https://foresight.org/foresight-space-workshop-2023/>)(<http://www.technovelgy.com/>) Workshops are essential to attract more talent.

   5. **Maintenance:** None.

4) **Key Result**: Task 5.4 Drive more Rapid Prototyping/Additive Manufacturing Professionals to MoonDAO with knowledge in 3D modeling and Simulations to support the Space Engineering Guild

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results**: [3D printing service USA cities](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1B8ieWsGTa0apZPnegVtLxlENuaITWgpMNit6C6TMFr0/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: 0.8**

   4. **Learnings:** I had chats with professional Hardware prototypers focusing on robotics and energy system. Sadly there was no concrete use case and value for these professionals to join our weekly SEG meetings. Despite the fact that it was 2 am for European connections. With the push of ESA Lunar Tender and other MoonDAO projects in the pipeline, I believe it will be more logical for experts to join MoonDAO for contribution and incentivization. Additionally I added a list of hardware prototyping facilities in the US for future outreach.

   5. **Maintenance:** None.

5) **Key Result**: Task 5.5 Connect more Intellectual Property attorneys focusing on Spacetech with MoonDAO

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results**: [IP Strategy Checklist by wipo.int](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Sr4NS80s9VTzEKo4Tunhz_U6GJ5PGTanNSuSxQDtaWE/edit?usp=sharing) [Directory of Intellectual Property Offices](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/131qXXv0ItSOKW2Qec0zQXVJt8N39-_rouQgHCNTDuUc/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score: 0.8**

   4. **Learnings:** (<https://www.wipo.int/technology-transfer/en/ip-policies.html>).

   5. **Maintenance:** None.

6) **Key Result**: Additional useful Databases

   1. **Member(s)**: Manuel

   2. **Results**: [DeSpace Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iStym4Y5hfGjBg4CITGleujqxsyAIPn5UI0HpjkuFmE/edit?usp=sharing) [Space Agencies Worldwide WIP](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ceShh6WKS7w4tTPhpqyX_OkdzVbYr5UA4b34_VMtP1U/edit?usp=sharing) [FI Spacetech Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qAgRl2U0zHYe3GBy_UhsF0kED66xJ6zD2U3e7XDE0ik/edit?usp=sharing)

   3. **Score:** See Task 1.2

   4. **Learnings:** Here are overviews of our current DeSpace ecosystem, an overview of the current Spacetech Ecosystem based on the Founders Institute Spacetech Report and Space Agencies worldwide for future partnerships, sponsoring, and ecosystem-building initiatives.

   5. **Maintenance:** None.
============================

# **Team Member Contributions**

# _Each member should take some time to fill this out with the specific contributions they had on the team. This will serve as a reference when team members are doing their Coordinape allocations. This is your chance to show off all the great work you did!_

### **@pmoncada**

# 1. **Objective**: Clarify the ultimate vision through a technical feasibility analysis to put together a technical roadmap towards achieving our ultimate goal. (Pablo, Ari, Rod, Sean Manuel)

   1. **Key Result**: Outline requirements and specifications on our Ultimate Goal of putting a self-sustaining, self-governing settlement on the Moon. 

      1. **Specific Contribution**: [MoonDAO 2030 Vision](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E4VtthW7lEdYboaumkrlJ01hqf298wMu9qniqeNL0fA/edit) [MoonDAO 2030 Vision Synthesis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1geglqndMT6eyKV3ML30p5eW0EpTGgeMEHDljv1FvE2M/edit) I wrote both of these documents and led discussions on each of these.

      2. **Impact:__** Those documents were the OKR. So as the author of those documents the bulk of the work was on my shoulders.

      3. **Complexity:** This took weeks to build and herding people to add their visions and synthesizing them further with discussion questions and getting something that we all agreed was a solid vision.

   2. **Key Result**: Create a full technical roadmap that works back from the ultimate goal with step-by-step milestones (e.g. one year plan, five year plan, ten year plan). **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contribution:**  [MoonDAO Roadmap 1.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16tYoSnkGms3gNJ3BGsKneMBXbaHBb51bSgAVlhE5A90/edit?usp=sharing)

      2. **Impact:** This roadmap will help inform our long term strategy at MoonDAO. As the author of the roadmap I did the bulk of the work here and led the discussions about the roadmap with others.

      3. **Complexity:** Despite only being a couple pages long, this roadmap synthesizes hundreds of hours of discussions and ideas about what it looks like to execute successfully on our mission.

   3. **Key Result:** Bring in subject area experts to speak to the DAO

      1. **Specific Contribution:** I lead the AMAs on our Twitter Spaces so I did multiple interviews with subject areas experts over the past three months.

      2. **Impact**: I lead all the AMAs, pretty self explanatory.

      3. **Complexity:** Logistics of getting people on, and then leading the discussions.

2. **Objective: Establish consistent Space Engineering Guild Internal Operations and toolsets/workflows for decentralized software and hardware coordination. (Pablo, Rod)**

   1. Task 2.1: Taking weekly guild notes, notification management (announcing when meetings are starting, collecting an agenda. **(Rod Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contribution:** I co-led this and created agendas.

   2. Task 2.5: Review incoming applications and assess their backgrounds on a consistent weekly basis, and assign them a Discord role, onboarding them, and providing support for orientation of the new members. **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contributions:** Responding to emails. We should have more metrics on this and a better dashboard for incoming applications.

   3. Task 2.6: Moderate and lead weekly guild discussions, making an agenda ahead of time and organizing the conversation for productive use of people’s time. **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contributions:** I led most guild meetings.

3. **Find one space engineering firm that is willing to outsource some of their tasks to create a bounty on our DeWork page as a pilot for a revenue stream in the DAO. (Pablo)**

   1. Task 4.1: Find at least one partner that is mission aligned with MoonDAO and is willing to have MoonDAO’s guild to complete a bounty for them. **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contribution:** Found someone, we followed up with them. But, unfortunately we did not put this together. This is a tough problem, and probably should be scoped out into its own project. Two way marketplace.

   2. Task 4.2: Manage the logistical, operations, and legal around matching that task with guild members and the right revenue split between the member and the company. **(Pablo Lead)**

      1. **Specific Contribution:** See above.

# Rod Mamin

# 1. **Task:** Task 1.1: Outline requirements and specifications on our Ultimate Goal of putting a self-sustaining, self-governing settlement on the Moon.  

   1. **Result:** shared my vision

2. **Task:** Task 1.4: Bring in subject area experts to speak to the DAO

   1. **Result:** brough Nadeem Gabbani, an engineer who has exp built satellites for the Moon to talk about challenges, and Owocki - founder of gitcoin

3. **Task:** Task 1.5 Help advise and review reports about technical feasibility in each of the three outlined areas.

   1. **Result:** provided feedback about lunar projects, including potential delay of IM-1 on conversation with BitBasel, and postponed delivery to Lifeship 

4. **Task:** Task 2.1: Taking weekly guild notes, notification management (announcing when meetings are starting, collecting an agenda.

   1. **Result:** missed only one meeting on 8th of March, all reports and agendas [**in this doc**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1M2918IUtOwIDtjKHLILuMrti4X9Ut_bIXIR7_Egy3_g/edit), also fixed missing SEG call in sesh on Discord

5. **Task:** Task 2.2: Investigation of available tooling and options for distributed hardware workflows, and operational workflows (investigating, deciding, integrating in the MoonDAO workflow).

Objective 5:** Figure out ways to converge Decentralized Science and Open Hardware to benefit the overall development of new and existing technology within MoonDAO. (Manuel Lead)1. **Key Result**: Task 5.1 Identify, build and implement Decentralized Science tools for scientists to contribute their research to MoonDAO.

   1. **Results**: [Space Technology Papers Results](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1tSVsb64LpinBsq7W_pvyCeU9nmQO7x0JbbJOQakA9Ac/edit?usp=sharing) [Challenges in Science - DeSci](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LSDjLuKZajuiStPK_ygJ9z7-NzQlRRoxVDwcQjyGDVg/edit?usp=sharing) [DeSpace ecosystem DeSci in Space.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UJIDjGMgtWL9cuQT3HhO6AiswUiOZ_5u/view?usp=sharing) [DeSpace: DeSci in Space](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vAJfI8GptpxeccmmAhzQcFDclORHpOcK48QjfcSIl6U/edit?usp=sharing) [Decentralized Science Twitter Landscape](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12EW9ecS3sgxKM_kijCYFXrQEODKX1MKO9ex8YczjSa0/edit?usp=sharing) [DeSci Tools Overview](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12JsoAJvMRc0G1MNd0fsrTUoa1tpag_9k9BGN6IExP70/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings: This report is for current and future MoonDAO members to orient in the Academic world, in the Intellectual Property markets and Prototyping facilities.** 

      1. The reason why I wanted to identify opportunities for either building or implementing Decentralized Science tools is that I strongly believe we can tap into undiscovered opportunities in DeSci and Regenerative Finance (ReFi). 

      2. If we can provide our members and other scientific communities with the tools to securely store and distribute scientific data we enable people to start working actively on hardware prototyping and data simulations for the best possible impact. [DeSci.World](http://desci.world) already created a comprehensive overview of DeSci projects. 

      3. With involvement in the upcoming DeSci survey, I will build the data stream for advanced data analytics. With this activity, our community stays up-to-date about the latest changes and opportunities for implementation in DeSci. 

      4. A positive sign that plays into this is the co-creation of our own NFT marketplace. We can create sub-systems that enable community members to register their own space papers paving the way for Space Scientists to get into DeSci through MoonDAO. This is my definition of Decentralized Space Exploration (DeSpace). 

      5. Further activities with Gitcoin to participate in the upcoming DeSci Grants round and the opportunity to build our own platform for distributing Grants for DeSpace ecosystem-building through the Gitcoin Grants Stack enable the positioning of MoonDAO as a leader in Decentralized Space Science paving the way for strategic partnerships. 

      6. Another opportunity related to DeSci and DeSpace is the creation of technological-specific Research Guilds or Sub-DAOs based on the complexity and fragmentation of space-related science and engineering. The potential to onboard massive scientific datasets, academic communities, and student groups is linked to the concept of B2B DAO in which we can partner up with major Research institutes and R\&D departments.

      7. For sure we can build these communities on our own and be more independent as a DAO but the most leverage is provided by partnering up with established stakeholders in Space Science. For this, we’ll need a straightforward B2B sales framework to win them in the long-run.

      8. First I had a look at the official NASAs Commercial Space Technology Roadmap (<https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/atoms/files/commercial_space_technology_roadmap.pdf>). 

      9. Based on the provided sectors and sub-sectors I collected trending papers from Google Scholar to provide our members with a comprehensive database of scientific papers ideally in PDF format. 

      10. Then I mapped out the general challenges and tasks we need to be aware of as a DAO when building tools on our own or partnering up with other players in DeSci to solve these challenges for our community members in science. 

      11. With a comprehensive presentation, I represented MoonDAO at ETHDenver talking about Decentralized Space Exploration and how to implement DeSci tools for solving these challenges. 

      12. Additionally, involvement in the upcoming DeSci Survey will provide us with real-world customer feedback to make better decisions about the prioritization of objectives while Gitcoins DeSci Telegram channel supports this objective to know about community-driven intitiatives. 

      13. I believe the low-hanging fruit is to engage the DeSci ecosystem as well while building partnerships with major sponsors and Grants protocols in web3 to enable Space Scientists with crypto crowdfunding opportunities to fund their research in the short term.

      14. For this I created a _DeSci Industry Overview based on Twitter activities and a DeSci Tools Overview using information from DeSci World on Github (_[_https://github.com/DeSciWorldDAO/awesome-desci_](https://github.com/DeSciWorldDAO/awesome-desci**)_)._

      15. Next steps are to reach out to the DeSci ecosystem with specific partnerships in mind while applying for Web3 and traditional Space Grants (like ESA Lunar Tender) with MoonDAO projects and building our own Grants Support Network with Web3 Foundations for the DeSpace ecosystem.

2. **Key Result**: Task 5.2 More qualified space scientists should be drawn to MoonDAO

   1. **Results:** [University\_USA\_College\_Towns](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/14n5Dq9PH8y6bijEM1w7g5ztd3SlijUAxWQcGA0Yb0-Q/edit?usp=sharing) [SU Exponential Innovation Best Practices](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fU8zuG1EwzyZ0S4MisU-2DMZvgRVquPAdzep5ux5zts/edit?usp=sharing) [YC Startup Advice](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Qg9Smz1RNPweew23GNeo89pkzZBmY_iAiiiErNVzu5w/edit?usp=sharing) [100 Tasks Checklist by Bell Ventures](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Lmd-AXkwvTWLqj9ExSfrxus4aJaPp5gArBcujmSgDzY/edit?usp=sharing) [DAO Building by BioDAO](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IbnTbVJLrm7wyCXfg0wzUgKES3oDcnBl929QuUd73UQ/edit?usp=sharing) [MoonDAO Space Science & Sustainability Guild Proposal WIP](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1HluxQPkTHV7egQYpeDaoIXjXCLlEEQHbI8lceb7Nm04/edit?usp=sharing) [Linkedin Campaign Space Scientists](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1BFbqLX1-BNNKhPZAjrp4J4YGzs4EAuHccPcMYfxxGqU/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings:****-Connecting to key decision-makers:**1. I had chats with the Military (Bundeswehr) University in Germany who work on a Space Accelerator program while exploring web3 applications. Contact got lost because of internal restructuring.

2. Will follow up in the next Quarter to work on this long-term. _They have connections to other major universities in Germany like Technical University Munich (TUM). Also, a student working group of RWTH university in Aachen is in touch with me and I want to explore more ways for Open Innovation and Hackathons there._

3. _Through Davos attendance, I was in touch with Open Access experts from MIT and Harvard, NASA, and CERN. Only with CERN there were serious chats about Technology and Knowledge Transfer._

4. Additionally, I started a Linkedin Connection Campaign with 277 NASA Scientists, did Follow-Ups and funneled the SEG pipeline to Rod for further SEG Onboarding.

5. I added a list of universities in the US for further partnership activities. We can build these lists individually for members looking for outreach activities in their individual regions.**-Strategizing _Open Entrepreneurship/ Innovation Frameworks:_** 1) So the goal here is really to create an Innovation Ecosystem where we use the principles of Open Science, Open Innovation, and Hardware Development for the initial value creation out of our DAO and beyond.

2) Additionally, I will lay out the methodologies and tools to do that for hyperlocal groups independently enabling the MoonDAO community to build their own innovation powerhouse.

3) For this, it is crucial to first ensure the Knowledge Transfer from Universities and R\&D departments to MoonDAO.

4) Second, it is necessary to capture the value again with either own incubation programs, joint university incubators, or external incubation/ acceleration.

5) From MoonDAOs perspective, it might be also useful to use Gitcoins Grants Stack as a Spin-Off launchpad for the DeSpace industry to get initial funding for R\&D and Technology Transfer Initiatives.

6) Additionally, we’ll need basic innovation management frameworks (<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1A5Pk1G07hFV0rHbrMQZAjag-AUREYz43?usp=sharing>) to ensure the competitiveness of our future projects and to enable a seamless Go-To-Market strategy and execution afterwards.

7) We can also use this for MoonDAO Corporate Innovation Consulting gigs to add additional revenue streams (<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ppQ-a8RO5dnN6HueynHcS2Ey0A7CzMZI/view?usp=sharing>)

8)  Especially if we cooperate with other corporations and startups it is useful to provide a straight-forward Venture Building and DAO Building approach if needed with specific milestones in place to measure our future projects success in later stages and to hold the initial team accountable (<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dQdYei_F4Ln4PBq1aazTiiwQoDG9m1ya/view?usp=sharing>).

9) **_I’m advocating for a University Advocacy/Fellowship Program for MoonDAO to engage local student communities._**

10) The best opportunities to get this forward are to stay connected with RWTH, TUM, and BWUNI in Germany and other universities around the globe to attract University Student Group leaders to MoonDAO.

11) Besides that, I reached out to NASA Technology Transfer without the success of getting them into a meeting.

12) We can use CERNs Open Science frameworks and explore Open Hardware prototyping opportunities with the universities.3. **Key Result**: Task 5.3 More futurists should be inspired to join MoonDAO

   1. **Results**: [Future Studies & Foresight Institutions](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10FGWdD9HOkYqxsTHUDEgOy3lKk1GzQqzepsmOEl4UMw/edit?usp=sharing) [Science Fiction Prototyping Framework](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1h_AMZXO_X8nVkDLTgUuMEsILdErCVjuEVfTxKOHOKm4/edit?usp=sharing) [Outline of Future Studies](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1O1OFKk4VopFbHxTGgJJ2xa-WUDlBZRSnDsTslnOTYRk/edit?usp=sharing) [Outline of Science & Technology Studies](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1pDS6bu4ude5g3h5USbIbiteqkw7Z3OB3seU9jlaW2aE/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings:**

      1. I believe that Future Thinking and Scenario Thinking Workshops for our community members can be valuable when it comes to modeling alternative realities through technological convergence in Space.

      2. These activities can lead the way for ideation and reality checks for upcoming MoonDAO projects and potential future impact.

      3. A potential community engagement activity can be Science Fiction Prototyping where we collectively design real-world concepts out of Sci-Fi future predictions (<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Science_fiction_prototyping>).

      4. While I did customer interviews with futurists to understand their needs for joining MoonDAO it was mainly related to creating revenue. Most futurists with a business want to win clients. These people are normally occupied either in a private corporation with less time or in entrepreneurial activities with time available if there are incentives. I believe our current Bounty system might be of value to attract more Futurists.

      5. Also for future partnerships, it might be useful to assess the innovation potential of each company so that we can connect futurists from our community to our own MoonDAO Referral Network with a focus on large corporations and public partners.

      6. Additionally, I’m in touch with Foresight Institute for joining or sponsoring their Space Workshop 2023 in June in California (<https://foresight.org/foresight-space-workshop-2023/>).

      7. Suited to this I created a framework for MoonDAO members to start their own Science Fiction Prototyping workshops and working groups. For future workshops, this is the online source where we can source Sci-Fi concepts (<http://www.technovelgy.com/>).

      8. I added an outline of Future Studies plus Science & Technology Studies topics & Techniques for members to educate themselves.

4. **Key Result**: Task 5.4 Drive more Rapid Prototyping/Additive Manufacturing Professionals to MoonDAO with knowledge in 3D modeling and Simulations to support the Space Engineering Guild

   1. **Results**: [3D printing service USA cities](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1B8ieWsGTa0apZPnegVtLxlENuaITWgpMNit6C6TMFr0/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings:**

      1. I had chats with professional Hardware prototypers focusing on robotics and energy system. Sadly there was no concrete use case and value for these professionals to join our weekly SEG meetings. Despite the fact that it was 2 am for European connections.

      2. With the push of ESA Lunar Tender and other MoonDAO projects in the pipeline, I believe it will be more logical for experts to join MoonDAO for contribution and incentivization.

      3. Additionally I added a list of hardware prototyping facilities in the US for future outreach.

5. **Key Result**: Task 5.5 Connect more Intellectual Property attorneys focusing on Spacetech with MoonDAO

   1. **Results**: [IP Strategy Checklist by wipo.int](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Sr4NS80s9VTzEKo4Tunhz_U6GJ5PGTanNSuSxQDtaWE/edit?usp=sharing) [Directory of Intellectual Property Offices](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/131qXXv0ItSOKW2Qec0zQXVJt8N39-_rouQgHCNTDuUc/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings:**

      1. I had chats with IP attorneys about regional and space-related specifications in IP markets. Sadly these people are super busy and super high paid so it’s not useful for us right now to actively attract this group to MoonDAO. This will be more valuable if we want to further commercialize IP or lay out licensing agreements or hold IP as a DAO.

      2. We need to work on a Governance Framework for IP globally tailored to the Space industry and web3 ethos of transparency and data ownership with Cyber Security and ITAR experts (<https://www.wipo.int/technology-transfer/en/ip-policies.html>).

6. **Key Result**: Additional useful Databases

   1. **Results**: [DeSpace Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iStym4Y5hfGjBg4CITGleujqxsyAIPn5UI0HpjkuFmE/edit?usp=sharing) [Space Agencies Worldwide WIP](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ceShh6WKS7w4tTPhpqyX_OkdzVbYr5UA4b34_VMtP1U/edit?usp=sharing) [FI Spacetech Ecosystem](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qAgRl2U0zHYe3GBy_UhsF0kED66xJ6zD2U3e7XDE0ik/edit?usp=sharing)

   2. **Learnings:**

      1. Here are overviews of our current DeSpace ecosystem, an overview of the current Spacetech Ecosystem based on the Founders Institute Spacetech Report and Space Agencies worldwide for future partnerships, sponsoring, and ecosystem-building initiatives.

@Justin Park1) **Objective**: Clarify the ultimate vision through a technical feasibility analysis to put together a technical roadmap towards achieving our ultimate goal. (Pablo, Ari, Rod, Sean Manuel, Justin)

   1. **Key Result**: Outline requirements and specifications on our Ultimate Goal of putting a self-sustaining, self-governing settlement on the Moon. 

      1. **Specific Contribution**: [MoonDAO 2030 Vision](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E4VtthW7lEdYboaumkrlJ01hqf298wMu9qniqeNL0fA/edit) [MoonDAO 2030 Vision Synthesis](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1geglqndMT6eyKV3ML30p5eW0EpTGgeMEHDljv1FvE2M/edit) I wrote both of these documents and led discussions on each of these.

      2. **Impact:__** Those documents were the OKR. So as the author of those documents the bulk of the work was on my shoulders.

      3. **Complexity:** This took weeks to build and herding people to add their visions and synthesizing them further with discussion questions and getting something that we all agreed was a solid vision.

   2. **Key Result**: Create a full technical roadmap that works back from the ultimate goal with step-by-step milestones (e.g. one year plan, five year plan, ten year plan).

      1. **Specific Contribution:**  [MoonDAO Roadmap 1.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16tYoSnkGms3gNJ3BGsKneMBXbaHBb51bSgAVlhE5A90/edit?usp=sharing)

      2. **Impact:** This roadmap will help inform our long term strategy at MoonDAO. As the author of the roadmap I did the bulk of the work here and led the discussions about the roadmap with others.

      3. **Complexity:** Despite only being a couple pages long, this roadmap synthesizes hundreds of hours of discussions and ideas about what it looks like to execute successfully on our mission.

   3. **Key Result:** Bring in subject area experts to speak to the DAO

      1. **Specific Contribution:** I lead the AMAs on our Twitter Spaces so I did multiple interviews with subject areas experts over the past three months.

      2. **Impact**: I lead all the AMAs, pretty self explanatory.
